titleStmt.title: C. M. Cunningham to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9673

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To his excellency,
the Honorable Beriah Magoffin,
Govenor of the State of Kentucky,

Your petitioner, Charles M. Cunningham states he was fined on the day of June 1860, before his honor Jas Harlan, Jr. J P. C. H. in the sum of fifty dollars with costs, for carrying a concealed, deadly weapon a pistol -- which said fine he has not paid.

Now, whereas your petitioner is not in the habit of carrying concealed deadly weapons, and whereas said pistol was at the time unloaded, and your petitioner otherwise keeping the peace; he humbly prays your excellency to cause said fine to be remitted.
Chas M. Cunningham says that he believes the statements of the foregoing petition are true
Sworn to before me by Chas M Cunningham this November 26th 1860
J, H Sillard J P M C
The undersigned respectfully join in the pray of your petitioner Chas M. Cunningham,

Chas W. Woods.
William E. Keller.
Jno P Haggin
James F. McKee
C. E. Poteet
Jim Q. Chenowith
Ben. C. Ingersoll
O S Poston
G D Pendergast
S M Thayer

Harrodsburg Po. ct.
Petition.
Respite 102 Mo
B. M
$50 } Concealed Weapons
C. M. Cunningham
Issd Decr 1. 1860
